Old Norse: Altfor reint har ingen smak.
English: Too clean has no taste.

Old Norse: Árinni kennir illur ræðari.
English: A bad rower blames the oar.

Old Norse: Bara döda fiskar följer strömmen.
English: Only dead fish follow the stream.

Old Norse: Båtlaus mann er bunden til land.
English: Boatless man is tied to the land.

Old Norse: Ber er hver að baki nema sér bróður eigi.
English: Bare is the back of a brotherless man.

Old Norse: Berre bok gjer ingen klok.
English: Merely book makes none wise.

Old Norse: Bra vind i ryggen er best.
English: A fair wind at our back is best.

Old Norse: Brennt barn forðast eldinn.
English: A burnt child keeps away from fire.

Old Norse: Den hund som bieffer meget, han bider ikkun lidet.
English: Barking dogs seldom bite.

Old Norse: Det är som mörkast innan gryningen.
English: It is darkest before dawn.

Old Norse: Det finns inget dåligt väder, bara dåliga kläder.
English: There is no bad weather, only bad clothing.

Old Norse: Det som göms i snö, kommer fram vid tö.
English: What is hidden in snow, is revealed at thaw.

Old Norse: Du skal kravle, før du kan gå.
English: You have to learn to crawl before you can walk.

Old Norse: Enn skal lytte, når en gammel hund gjø.
English: One should listen when an old dog barks.

Old Norse: Gammel kjærleik rustar ikkje.
English: Old love does not corrode.

Old Norse: Ju senare på kvällen, desto vackrare folk.
English: The later in the evening, the more beautiful the people.

Old Norse: Kemst þó hægt fari.
English: You will reach your destination even though you travel slowly.

Old Norse: Lidet er om den mans vrede, som ingen vurder.
English: If you cannot bite, never show your teeth.

Old Norse: Man må hyle med de ulve man er i blandt.
English: One must howl with the wolves one is among.

Old Norse: Sjaldan er ein báran stök.
English: There seldom is a single wave.

Old Norse: Tíðin rennur sum streymur í á.
English: Time runs like the river current.
